description: [Status: stable] [Name: repeated-keyword-argument] [Message: Repeated keyword argument: {duplicate_keyword}] What it does Checks for repeated keyword arguments in function calls. Why is this bad? Python does not allow repeated keyword arguments in function calls. If a function is called with the same keyword argument multiple times, the interpreter will raise an exception. Example func(1, 2, c=3, **{"c": 4})
